entry.title: Playing with cardboard and controlling a delta-2 robot
entry.content:
After developing the kinematics algorithms of a delta-2 robot, we want to test it in a real environment. For doing this we built the links using cardboard and connect them to real servo-drives.



Go to my wiki to continue reading.

link.title: Playing with cardboard and controlling a delta-2 robot

entry.title: How to - Kinematics of a delta-2 robot
entry.content:
A delta-2 robot is a parallel robot composed by two legs,
each one has three rational joints but only the one attached to the fixed-frame (or top-plate) is not a passive joint. Therefore, to move the end-effector position (TCP-0) of the robot the two active (or controlled) joints must be controlled.

The delta-2 robot is a simplification of the delta-3 robot, and it is usually used in the packaging industry for pick products on a conveyor belt. You can look some models in Codian Robotics web page.

Read more about how to solve the kinematics problem.

link.title: How to - Kinematics of a delta-2 robot

entry.title: Study kinematics of a delta-3 robot using a cardboard model
entry.content:
Sometimes it is useful to create a simple prototype when you are studying a complex robot as parallel ones are. A prototype can help you to understand how its structure reacts when one or more actuated joints are modified.

Read the note to know how I built a prototype with cardboard.

link.title: Study kinematics of a delta-3 robot using a cardboard model
